Module roborally
Package client.view

Class GameBoardController

java.lang.Object
client.view.GameBoardController
public class GameBoardController
extends java.lang.Object
Controller for the 2d gameboard displayed in the GameView and ServerView. Displays the board, robots, lasers amd their animations.
Author:
simon, Amulya

    • buildMap

      public void buildMap​(GameStarted gameStarted)
      This method builds the map based on the map received from the gameStarted protocol message.
      Parameters:
      gameStarted - protocol message type which is to be handled

    • sortBoardAttributes

      private java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> sortBoardAttributes​(java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> field)

      Parameters:
      field - arraylist of the attribute
      Returns:
      sorted arrayList

    • isTileBackgroundEmpty

      private boolean isTileBackgroundEmpty​(java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> field)
      Method tests if the background of all attributes on a field are transparent.
      Parameters:
      field - Field to test
      Returns:
      True if the Tile is transparent.

    • placeRobotInMap

      public void placeRobotInMap​(Player player, Coordinate coordinate)
      This method places the robot on the board based on the starting point player chooses.
      Parameters:
      player - current player
      coordinate - position chosen by the player on the board

    • handleMovement

      public void handleMovement​(Player player, Coordinate newPos)
      This method moves the player in the view based on the argument received and updates the player position after every method call on the client side to keep track of position to update the view later.
      Parameters:
      player - Player whose robot should be moved
      newPos - new Position of robot after movement is handled

    • handlePlayerTurning

      public void handlePlayerTurning​(Player player, int angle)
      This method rotates the player in the view based on the argument received and updates the player orientation after every method call on the client side to keep track of orientation to update the view later.
      Parameters:
      player - Player whose robot should be turned
      angle - Parameter that determines how the player should be rotated.

    • handleShooting

      @Deprecated public void handleShooting​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      Deprecated.
      This method only shows the animation of laser beam being fired in the view. The laser beam will terminate abruptly if it hits the robot or wall on it's way.
      Parameters:
      players - active player list

    • handleRobotShooting

      @Deprecated public void handleRobotShooting​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      Deprecated.
      This method only shows the animation of laser beam being fired in the view. The laser beam will terminate abruptly if it hits the robot or wall on it's way. The robot can fire from any position as long as it is playing in the current round.
      Parameters:
      players - active player list

    • robotLaserAnimation

      public void robotLaserAnimation​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      This method shows the animation of laser beam being fired in the view.
      Parameters:
      players - active player list

    • boardLaserAnimation

      public void boardLaserAnimation​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players)
      This method shows the animation of laser beam being fired in the view.
      Parameters:
      players - active player list

    • laserAnimation

      private void laserAnimation​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, Orientation orientation, Coordinate startPos)
      This method shows the laser beam traversing. The laser beam will terminate abruptly if it hits the robot or wall on it's way.
      Parameters:
      players - arrayList of the players
      orientation - orientation of laser or robot
      startPos - position of robot or laser

    • isLaserHittingRobot

      private boolean isLaserHittingRobot​(java.util.ArrayList<Player> players, Coordinate endPos, int distance)
      This method checks whether the player is on the path of traversing beam.
      Parameters:
      players - playersList
      endPos - end position
      distance - distance
      Returns:
      true if it hits the robot

    • createHitAnimation

      private javafx.scene.Group createHitAnimation​(Coordinate endPos, Coordinate vector, Orientation orientation)
      This method creates the hit animation. As the player gets shot by laser, an impact image is shown.
      Parameters:
      endPos - position where impact is to be shown
      vector - from where the laser is fired
      orientation - orientation of the beam
      Returns:

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(Player player)
      It removes the player's robot from the robot pane.
      Parameters:
      player - whose robot is to be removed from the robot pane.
